title: Six straight wins later — are the Patriots officially back?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: The New England Patriots have achieved a six-game win streak, with rookie quarterback Drake Maye leading the team.
Under head coach Mike Vrabel, the Patriots hold a 7-2 record, showcasing resilience and standout performances from key players.
The team's recent success stirs optimism among fans reminiscent of the Tom Brady era and raises questions about their resurgence.

title: New UMass poll shows Markey with firm lead over Moulton
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: UMass Amherst/WCVB poll shows Sen. Ed Markey leads Rep. Seth Moulton 51% to 28% in Democratic primary race.
If Rep. Ayanna Pressley enters, Markey's lead decreases, leading with 35% against Moulton's 25% and Pressley's 21%.
Voters view Markey as 'old' and Moulton as 'unknown', with Markey's approval rating at 54%, according to the UMass poll.

title: Mass. man missing after leaving hospital early Friday morning
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Leonard Mercury, 57, is missing after leaving Heywood Hospital in Gardner around 2 a.m. on Friday.
Mercury was last seen walking toward a bike path wearing hospital clothes and no shoes.
Police urge anyone with information to avoid contacting him and call 911 or Gardner police at 978-632-5600.

title: ‘We’re feeling that first-snow magic’: New England ski resorts delight in the season’s first snow
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: New England ski resorts, including Sunday River and Jay Peak, celebrate the first snowfall of the season.
Bretton Woods in New Hampshire plans to open for the season on November 28 amid early snowfall and snowmaking efforts.
Stowe Mountain and Killington resorts in Vermont have begun snowmaking, with opening dates set for November 22 and pending respectively.

title: 5 new restaurants we’re excited to try in November
author: Jillian Dara
bullets: All'Antico Vinaio, a famous Florentine sandwich shop, has opened a new location in Boston's Back Bay.
Capricho Colombian Steakhouse, owned by Vanessa Dorta and Carlos Gómez, has launched in West Roxbury.
Twisted Fate Brewing opened its second taproom in Revere's Suffolk Downs, offering 16 brews and a new onsite restaurant.

title: Former Gov. Charlie Baker’s father dies at 97
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Charles D. Baker III, father of former Gov. Charlie Baker, died at 97 in Needham on Saturday.
Baker III was a government official and led consulting firm Harbridge House, serving major U.S. departments.
He taught at Northeastern University, earning awards for his popular teaching style and respected approach.

title: Falcons accused Patriots of illegal simulation of a snap on crucial fourth quarter play
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Atlanta Falcons accuse New England Patriots of illegally simulating a snap in crucial fourth quarter play.
Patriots allegedly mimicked Falcons quarterback Michael Penix Jr.'s clapping, leading to a detrimental grounding penalty.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel humorously addressed the accusation, attributing noise to fans' energy.

title: A Worcester woman has been missing since leaving work Friday morning
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Joanna Brown, 30, missing since leaving Bean Counter Bakery Cafe in Worcester at 9 a.m. on Friday.
She is 5-foot-6 with hazel eyes, possibly in Holyoke or Springfield, driving a 2025 Gray Mitsubishi Outlander.
Police urge anyone with information to contact Worcester Police Department at 508-799-8606 or call 911.

title: ‘Clapgate’: Mike Vrabel responded to Falcons’ accusations of Patriots’ illegal clapping
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel responded to Falcons' accusations of illegal snap simulation by the Patriots, denying any wrongdoing in 'Clapgate'.
Vrabel praised DeMario Douglas for his performance despite a personal tragedy, offering support to the wide receiver and his family.
Vrabel discussed the Patriots' trade deadline strategy, expressing no urgency to make deals despite the team's 7-2 record.

title: Lululemon shoplifting spree continues in Boston
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Two Lululemon locations in Boston were targeted by shoplifters, marking the fourth such incident in a month.
A group of 15 stole $4,000 in merchandise from the Boylston St. location; suspects fled towards Boston Public Library.
A separate incident at the Prudential Center location resulted in a $634 loss; police recovered suspect's belongings.
